body:
Thanks for the suggestion. I don't think that's the right way to handle this, as that's a lot of text for an aside. 

What I think we should do instead is:

1. Update [this section](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/?tab=readme-ov-file#stylistic-rule-updates) of the README to say "Frozen rules" instead of "Stylistic rules"
2. Add a link in the website banner to that section of the README. So the banner becomes "This rule is currently frozen and is not accepting changes. ([Read more](#))"

What do you think?

issue.title: Docs: Clarify that frozen rules will still receive bug fixes?

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
### Docs page(s)

Docs pages of ❄ frozen rules, such as:
* https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/default-param-last
* https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/dot-notation


### What documentation issue do you want to solve?

Coming over from https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/10669#issuecomment-2601025196: we noticed that the phrasing indicates they receive _no_ changes:

> ❄️ This rule is currently frozen and is not accepting changes.

But, if a critical bug is discovered in a rule -e.g. for a new JS syntax that reaches stage 3/4- then ESLint core will fix the rule, right? I interpreted the freeze as being just for _feature requests_ and other non-critical additions.

### What do you think is the correct solution?

Maybe tweaking it slightly to just say feature requests?

> ❄️ This rule is currently frozen and is not accepting feature requests.


### Participation

- [x] I am willing to submit a pull request for this change.

### Additional comments

For quick reference: the ❄ indicators came from #18694 -> #19231

body:
Coming over from #19347 (thanks @rakleed!): personally I think just tweaking the wording on the rule docs pages would be sufficient:

```diff
- ❄️ This rule is currently frozen and is not accepting changes.
+ ❄️ This rule is currently frozen and is not accepting feature requests.
```
Good idea @JoshuaKGoldberg, much easier. @rakleed do you want to submit a PR for that change?

issue.title: docs: clarify frozen rule description

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [OpenJS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[x] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

- Added a section on the Core Rules page explaining what a frozen rule is.
- Updated the frozen rules banner to link to the description of what a frozen rule is.
- Removed the section on stylistic rules from the README. I don't think this is necessary now that we are marking rules as frozen. Whether or not they are stylistic is of no consequence.

fixes #19346

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->
